metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10767 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel before 5.8-rc1 in the implementationof the Enhanced IBPB (Indirect Branch Prediction Barrier). The IBPBmitigation will be disabled when STIBP is not available or when theEnhanced Indirect Branch Restricted Speculation (IBRS) is available. Thisflaw allows a local attacker to perform a Spectre V2 style attack when thisconfiguration is active. The highest threat from this vulnerability is toconfidentiality.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10767` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-64-generic - 5.3.0-64.58~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-115.116').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-64.58~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1072.73').
